dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 5378 IH: Tribal Healthcare Careers Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Gomez introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To provide a set-aside of funds for Indian populations under the health profession opportunity grant program under section 2008 of the Social Security Act, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Tribal Healthcare Careers Act.

section.header: Set-aside of funds for Indian populations
section.text: Section 2008(c)(1) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1397g(c)(1)) is amended by inserting 15 percent of which for each fiscal year shall be reserved for grants to Indian tribes, tribal organizations, and Tribal Colleges and Universities before the period.

section.header: Guarantee of grants for Indian populations
section.text: Section 2008(a)(2)(C) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1397(a)(2)(C)) is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.header: Guarantee of grants for Indian populations
subparagraph.text: The Secretary shall award at least 10 grants under this subsection to an eligible entity that is an Indian tribe, a tribal organization, or a Tribal College or University, to the extent there are a sufficient number of applications submitted by such an eligible entity that meet the requirements of subparagraph (B).

section.text: The amendments made by this Act shall take effect on October 1, 2025.
